{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3492536,"name":"Samuel Helton","username":"Bigmansam34","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/9dc877/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-25T19:23:34.176Z","cooked":"

While trying to configure the VH-109 to wireless access mode, the diagrams they used confused me. it was my understanding that you would connect one radio to your driver station, and then connect to the robot radio using the DS radio and be able to communicate to the robot, but upon testing this does not work. Is there a different way to do this? I could have read something incorrectly, and any help is appreciated. Thanks!

Your thoughts are correct.

With your DS and DS radio connected, navigate to the radios configuration page.

After updating firmware, set the network SSID and password there (not through Windows like your built in wireless card).

Similarly you need to wired teather to the robot radio and configure the same SSID and password.

Then when both are turned on they will automatically connect!

https://frc-radio.vivid-hosting.net/overview/quick-start-guide
